title: [iOS] - account import out of memory crash
body:
Geth version: `Geth (1.7.2)`
OS & Version: iOS 11.1.2

#### Bug description
When I call `.importKey(keyJSON, passphrase:, newPassphrase:)` first time with wrong import password it throws error as expected.

But when I call it for the second time (good or wrong password) it crash with `out of memory` error.

#### Backtrace


Are you using Geth.LightScryptN and Geth.LightScryptP?
OK then it must be something different - just looked you might have had the same as this dev: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/14459
@lprokein How's going on now, bro. I have the same issue as you now, any solution?

You were trying to decrypt a key that used the standard encryption parameters (needs 256MB of memory for decoding). That's way too heavy for a mobile (or might explain your limits).

```
runtime: out of memory: cannot allocate 268435456-byte block
```

Please make sure that any keys decrypted on a mobile have originally been encrypted with Light KDF flags.
